result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Branch 11

Defendant Latrice R Brooks in court, in custody.  Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson in court for Latrice R Brooks.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Witness MPD PO Jane Preston, duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Jay. Venue established. Witness identification. Defn require proof of photos; argument by Atty Watson. Argument by ADA Jay. Argument by Atty Watson. Colloquy w/ ADA Jay. CT makes findings and finds physical photos are not required/necessary for foundation for this hearing. Direct exam cont. Cross Exam by Atty Watson. Exam by CT. Cross exam cont. by Atty Watson. Redirect exam by ADA Jay. Re-cross exam by Atty Watson. Re-cross exam by ADA Jay. Witness excused at 4:27 pm. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Watson. CT makes findings and found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 11. RFS on filed; defn has co-defns. ARRAIGNMENT TO BE HELD WITH THE TRIAL BRANCH. Counsel stipulate to amending cash bond to signature bond. Defn on PO hold until Monday when a Tx bed is available. CT directs counsel to submit stip and order and Judge McNamara to sign.
